abstract_summ: RESULTS The mean clinical onset serial interval and mean diagnostic serial interval were estimated to be 3.58 days (95% CI: 2.62, 4.53) and 3.68 days (95% CI: 3.14, 4.22), respectively.Results Accounting for right truncation and analyzing all pairs, we estimated the median serial interval at 4.0 days (95% credible interval [CrI]: 3.1, 4.9).We study and compare the clinical onset and diagnostic serial intervals of SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19 in South Korea.Results: Accounting for right truncation and analyzing all pairs, we estimated the median serial interval at 4.0 days (95% credible interval [CrI]: 3.1, 4.9).The generation time, also known as the generation interval, is the time between infection events in an infector infectee pair.
title_summ: Serial interval of novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infectionsClinical onset serial interval and diagnostic serial interval of SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19 in South KoreaA rapid review of available evidence on the serial interval and generation time of COVID-19Serial interval of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) infections
title_abstract_phrases: Serial interval of novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infectionsObjective: To estimate the serial interval of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) from information on 28 infector-infectee pairs.RESULTS The mean clinical onset serial interval and mean diagnostic serial interval were estimated to be 3.58 days (95% CI: 2.62, 4.53) and 3.68 days (95% CI: 3.14, 4.22), respectively.The COVID-19 serial interval is also shorter than the serial interval of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), indicating that calculations made using the SARS serial interval may introduce bias.Results Accounting for right truncation and analyzing all pairs, we estimated the median serial interval at 4.0 days (95% credible interval [CrI]: 3.1, 4.9).We study and compare the clinical onset and diagnostic serial intervals of SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19 in South Korea.
